intro: Lissanthe, commonly known as the "false dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Africa, particularly South Africa. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped or linear, and they produce small, yellow or white flowers arranged in a composite head. Lissanthe species are often found in grasslands and open habitats, and they are adapted to dry conditions. Some species are cultivated for ornamental purposes due to their delicate appearance and ease of growth.
